title: The Spiral Model
description: A quick, practical guide to The Spiral Model.

hook.text: Barry Boehm proposed building software in spirals â€” plan, build, evaluate risk, then repeat.

buildup.text: Each spiral cycle produced a prototype. Stakeholders could see progress and redirect early.

discovery.text: Risk analysis at every cycle prevented teams from investing heavily in doomed approaches.

twist.text: The spiral model was complex to manage. Most teams simplified it or abandoned it for lighter methods.

climax.text: But its core insight survived: iterate, manage risk, and get feedback early. Agile inherited this DNA.

punchline.text: Build a little, learn a lot, then build again.

quiz.question: What was the spiral model's key innovation?
options: Risk analysis at every iteration cycle
One single delivery at the end
